newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends up in kerb, seen rising.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends up in kerb, seen rising.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.05 rupees up at 42.55 to the dollar on Thursday in kerb trading marked by profit-taking in dollars. Dealers said the rupee would open higher after the Friday weekend.

They said profit-taking was prompted by Tuesday's 7.86 percent rupee devaluation against the dollar. The state (central) Bank of Pakistan devalued the rupee to 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar from 36.9700/37.1549 set on September 10. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 6.30 percent, compared with its previous close at 6.25 percent.
